title: Icac: Joe Tripodi takes the stand | World news | The Guardian
summary: joe tripodi faces questioning over coal loader .
former labor minister tony kelly takes his seat .
tinkler moves to clear his name ahead of half-billion dollar wall st investment drive .

text: that 's a wrap from icac for this week .

here 's where we leave things : nathan tinkler has told the inquiry that he regrets the day he ever invested in the newcastle property developer , buildev , claiming he has been made a scapegoat '' by former executives of the company for the alleged corruption being investigated by icac tinkler has insisted he knew nothing of the secret smear campaign conducted against the former member for newcastle , jodi mckay , who lost her seat at the 2011 election .
mckay was a vocal opponent of a coal terminal project that would have benefited tinkler 's mining interests .

tinkler 's lawyer has unsuccessfully tried to have the commission withdraw the extraordinary and damaging '' allegations of corrupt conduct made against the former coal baron , saying the stench of the accusations is impeding tinkler 's efforts to raise money from american investors .
disgraced former nsw labor minister joe tripodi has denied lobbying the former labor government to stop a container terminal deal that would have ruined buildev 's plans for a coal terminal .
the inquiry has seen evidence that days before the container terminal project was halted , tripodi had flown to newcastle to meet with senior buildev executives .
minutes from the meeting show that buildev understood that tripodi would help them scupper the rival project .
commissioner latham has called time on a heated examination of the former labor minister joe tripodi at the independent commission against corruption .
tripodi will return to the stand when the inquiry resumes at 10am next week .
tripodi maintains that to the best of my recollection '' he never went to eric roozendaal to scupper the anglo ports container terminal deal .
but watson is n't buying it .
he shows tripodi evidence that days after the meeting with buildev , former labor treasurer eric roozendaal did indeed stop the anglo ports deal going to the newcastle ports corporation board .
do you accept that you went to mr roozendaal to get him to stop the anglo deal going to the npc board , '' watson asks .
all of the evidence points one way .
that you agreed to do this , and you did do it , '' he adds i have no recollection of speaking to mr roozendaal about this , '' tripodi says , now shouting .
you were there acting as their adviser .
you were their mate .
you were advising them , you were assisting them in relation to this coal loader deal , '' watson says .
i was there to listen i was not their mate , '' tripodi says .

now watson asks why buildev executive david sharpe made a note following his meeting with tripodi that the former fairfield mp was going to get eric to stop anglo deal going to board this thursday '' .
the anglo deal '' in question was the container terminal that anglo ports was trying to build in place of buildev 's coal loader .
so what 's that all about ? ''
watson asks .
it 's a suggestation that i was going to approach eric roozendaal to speak to him about the anglo deal going to the npc board and it being stopped , '' he replies .
you agreed to do that , '' watson says .
oh , no , i didnt agree to do that , '' tripodi says .
i do n't recall the discussions to do that . ''
he goes on : to the best of my recollection , i did not speak to eric roozendaal about that . ''
we 're deep in the minutiae of competition law as it applies to port policy now , but the exchanges between tripodi and watson are getting increasingly tetchy .
a sample : watson : i know you 've got some background in economics , but you 're not a lawyer , is that right ? ''
tripodi : and you 're not an economist . ''
watson : and thank god for that ! ''
commissioner latham is trying to get the questioning back on track , trying to establish exactly what followed tripodi 's meeting with buildev .
she wants to know whether he tried to get access to the legal advice that the newcastle ports corporation was using to oppose buildev 's coal terminal proposal .
tripodi gives an unequivocal no '' .
the abc 's sarah gerathy sums it up : sarah gerathy ( @ sarahgerathy ) summary of tripodi 's evidence to # icac so far : he loves ports , and took a chopper ride to newcastle .
lather , rinse , repeat .
now watson is trying to establish why tripodi went to visit buildev that day .
what role did you see that you had in the proposal going forward ? ''
he asks .
role ?
i was more interested in learning what was happening , '' tripodi replies .
what was in it for buildev ? ''
watson presses .
probably to learn from my knowledge , '' tripodi says .
and also my interest in the policy area , and what was happening in the industry since i 'd left it , '' he adds .
tripodi 's grey suit is pulled tightly around his stocky frame and the former fairfield mp sounds a little meek in response to watson 's aggressive questioning .
he 's already been found to be corrupt by icac in a june report .

here 's a taste of that story , from my colleague helen davidson : tripodi was found to have engaged in corrupt conduct by not disclosing to the cabinet his awareness of obeid 's connections to the cafes , and dunn for using his public official position to bring about a change in maritime 's commercial lease policy in order to benefit obeid .
however neither man was referred to the dpp .
read the full story here
commissioner latham is asking why tripodi accepted buildev 's invitation to fly to newcastle and meet them to discuss the coal loader .
i have a genuine interest in that area of policy about ports , and port reform , and issues that confront ports , '' port-enthusiast tripodi replies .
watson : did you know that you were going up there [ to buildev 's office ] in a helicopter to look at the issue of a coal loader ? ''
tripodi : i suspected so yes . ''
in november 2010 , tripodi flew to newcastle to meet with buildev .
why ?
watson asks .
our policy interests and policy concerns are not confined to the electoral boundaries , '' the softly-spoken tripodi replies .
watson has started strongly , asking tripodi if he considered his position as the member for fairfield to be a full-time job '' .
did it keep you busy ?
you did n't have any other part-time jobs ? ''
watson asks .

documents.title: joe tripodi faces questioning over coal loader
text: just like that , tony kelly is gone .
joe tripodi waits in the wings .

by way of backstory , the site that buildev was eyeing for its shiny new mayfield coal terminal was already marked out by the nsw government-owned newcastle ports corporation for another project , a container terminal , to be built by anglo ports .
counsel assisting geoffrey watson has alleged that as early as october 2010 , joe tripodi was agitating within the nsw labor government for buildev 's coal terminal instead .
in his opening address , watson showed the inquiry a note created by a buildev executive , allegedly outlining the company 's strategy for knocking the coal terminal on the head .
among other things , it read : joe is going to get eric to stop anglo deal going to board this thursday . ''
( the eric '' is presumed to be eric roozendaal , the treasurer at the time . )
so the allegation is that tripodi torpedoed the container terminal deal on behalf of buildev .
he also allegedly helped to orchestrate the campaign against his then-labor colleague , jodi mckay .
two big accusations .
he 's just taken his seat .
the man up next , joe tripodi , has been accused of doing buildev 's bidding in the final months of his political career in order to secure a job with the property developer after the election .
watson is asking whether tripodi , then a backbencher , ever talked to kelly about buildev 's desire to build a coal terminal in mayfield .
i really cant remember joe tripodi talking to me abotu buildev .
i ca n't say that he did n't , but i do n't remember that he did , '' kelly says .

documents.title: former labor minister tony kelly takes his seat
text: we 're back from lunch , with former labor minister tony kelly in the stand .
kelly was found to have engaged in corrupt conduct by a previous icac inquiry .

in the dying days of the previous labor government , the then-lands minister kelly signed off on a property purchase when he had no authorisation to do so , backdating a letter approving the purchase so it would appear he had signed it before the caretaker period of government had commenced .
he 's involved in this inquiry because of an email obtained by the commission , sent by david sharpe from buildev , outlining the company 's strategy for securing its coal loader .
one of the strategic plans outlined in sharpe 's email read : buildev will contract tony kelly to make sure that he is still onside .
buildev shall do the same with warwick watkins . ''
does that suggest a relationship with buildev that involved corrupt conduct or illegal donations ?
watson will be pressing kelly to find out .
and with that , we break for lunch .
former labor ministers tony kelly and joe tripodi to come .
the first write-ups on tinkler 's appearance are coming through , fleshing out some other lines from his evidence .

from the daily telegraph : mining mogul nathan tinkler has told icac that an alleged illegal $ 53,000 donation to the nsw liberal party was intended for the federal party , and was organised by former deputy prime minister mark vaile .
mr tinkler 's donation was made ahead of the 2011 election , when he was a property developer , and developers have been banned from making donations to state election campaigns since 2009 .
read the full report here

documents.title: tinkler moves to clear his name ahead of half-billion dollar wall st investment drive
text: paddy manning , the author of boganaire , an unauthorised biography of tinkler , is saying that tinkler continues to own 49.9 % of the company .

paddy manning ( @ gpaddymanning ) currently asic shows tinkler 's oceltip property still holds 49.9 % of buildev group # icac & today we learn there was a 50 % management agree't meanwhile , tinkler 's qc is on his feet demanding that the commissioner accept an application that the former coal magnate is innocent of the allegations of the most extraordinary and damaging kind '' that have been levelled at him during the course of this inquiry .
he says tinkler is going to wall st next week with an endeavour to raise half a billion dollars '' from investors , and the allegations at icac will severely damage his chance .
[ the inquiry ] has completely destroyed this man 's ability to continue to conduct his legitimate affairs as a private citizen in this country and around the world .
that 's my application , '' tinkler 's silk says .
mr tinkler is simply going to have to stand on his merits and rebuff any allegations of corrupt allegations , '' latham says .
the application is noted and refused . ''
now commissioner megan latham is pressing tinkler to admit he had a stronger interest in buildev 's business than he claims .
referring to the coal loader , latham says , that was your pet project , was n't it ? ''
[ building it ] would have been a good outcome , '' tinkler says .
no , no , no , '' she says .
that was your number one priority was n't it ? ''
no , i had plenty of other things to do , '' tinkler says .
we 're hearing now from the qcs appearing for other players in this drama , who are taking turns questioning tinkler .
most interesting are the representatives for david sharpe and darren williams , the buildev executives from who tinkler has been at pains to distance himself at today 's hearing .
david sharpe 's qc is on her feet now .
she has put it to tinkler that at the time of the coal loader saga , he had 50 % decision-making power at buildev , and that he was regularly briefed on the progress of the project .
i never controlled buildev , '' tinkler maintains .
she puts it to him that you were involved in the day to day progressing of the projects and you were intimately involved and interested in the progress of the projects '' .
tinkler scoffs .
i 'm not a property developer .
that 's not what i do . ''
well !
in a slight anti-climax , watson has wrapped up his questioning of tinkler .
but not without asking one last question .
tinkler 's lawyer had put it to jodi mckay last week that she had propositioned '' tinkler for an illegal donation in 2011 .
watson suggests that tinkler has simple made up '' this allegation .
she come to see me to see if she had my support , '' tinkler says .
and i said she did n't . ''
by support , i thought she meant money , '' he says .
mckay has strongly denied the accusation .
tinkler 's silk is now questioning his client .
the media room a little aghast at the quick end of tinkler 's grilling by watson .
but we 've been promised joe tripodi will appear in the stands before the day is out .
tinkler is at pains to distance himself from the property developer buildev , the company whose political machinations have come under such scrutiny at this hearing .
buildev was never part of the tinkler group .
they were never run out of of our office .
i was a minority shareholder in the company an investment i deeply regret now , '' he says .
buildev is not me .
i own 9 % of buildev .
how does that become 'me ' ? ''
he says that the company has set us up and used us as a scapegoat '' .
jodi mckay has come up .
tinkler is being presented with a text message he was sent by former buildev executive , david sharpe .
also we will be doing research on jodies disclosures last elections and see what skeletons she has in her closet i am sure the herald happy to print , '' the text said .
lol i feel a letterbox drop coming on , '' tinkler replied .
despite this , he denies have any knowledge of the letterbox drop against mckay that buildev allegedly funded .
i do n't know anything about th econtext of the letterbox drop , nor was i a part of it .
putting something in someone 's letter box is hardly a big deal , '' he shrugs .
plenty of people do it to me . ''
the inquiry has seen various references to money coming from the big man '' , including $ 120,000 that was expected to be paid to the newcastle alliance .
tinkler has denied he was the big man '' in question .
he says the inquiry has shown him how many people used my name for their own advantage '' .
all of these people that i do n't know , trading on my reputation , '' he says ruefully .
watson is outlining the chain of events by which tinkler 's money allegedly found its way into nsw liberal party election campaigns .
he says a $ 53,000 cheque got off the desk of [ tinkler employee ] troy palmer and into office of christopher hartcher '' .

from there , watson says , a hartcher staffer mailed the cheques to the nsw liberal party , where senior fundraiser paul nicoleau passed them onto the liberal party associated entity , the free enterprise foundation ( fef ) .
the implication by watson is that the prohibited money was washed '' by the fef and then passed onto owen and bassett .
watson : you ca n't shed any light on this for us ? ''
tinkler : no , i ca n't . ''
tinkler and watson clashed the last time the former coal baron appeared at icac .
tinkler did little to hide his frustration with watson 's peppering questions and attempts to draw out forensic detail , sometimes of events that were up to five years old .
today finds a much more genial tinkler in the chair .
michaela whitbourn ( @ mwhitbourn ) `` you wanted jodi mckay out of the seat , you wanted labor gone in newcastle ? ''
# icac counsel says .
tinkler agrees he wanted `` change '' .
kate mcclymont ( @ kate mcclymont ) `` i call nathan tinkler '' # icac his face set in a scowl , tinkler is in the stand denying any involvement in the infamous mckay flyers .
counsel assisting geoffrey watson , sc : what do you know about the mailouts which were so negative to jodi mckay ? ''
tinkler : nothing . ''
he 's also said he has no knowledge '' of how part of $ 53,000 that buildev donated to the free enterprise foundation ended up in the campaign account of newcastle mp tim owen .
part of that money also allegedly went to londonderry mp bart bassett .
i had no idea who bart bassett was , '' tinkler says .
welcome to our live coverage of a blockbuster day at the independent commission against corruption , as one-time coal billionaire nathan tinkler makes his long-awaited appearance in the stands .

tinkler is expected to face forensic questioning on allegations that have been raised in the course of this hearing , and in earlier hearings in may , that along with his deputies , the so-called boganaire '' concocted various schemes to continue making donations to nsw state politicians after money from property developers was banned in 2009 .
allegations of taking tinkler money have seen at least four nsw liberal mps move to the cross-benches or resign from office , most recently the member for londonderry , bart bassett .
he will front the inquiry next week to answer accusations his 2011 election campaign received an $ 18,000 donation from the part tinkler-owned property developer , buildev .
bassett maintains his innocence .
five other liberal mps have been drawn into the fray and stood down for allegedly taking illegal donations from other property developers .

the most sensational allegations against tinker centre on a shadowy smear campaign conducted against the former labor member for newcastle , jodi mckay , who was vocally opposed to tinkler 's plan to build a coal loader at mayfield to service his enormous coal mine at maules creek .
ann wills , a former tinkler staffer and associate of former nsw labor minister , joe tripodi , admitted this week that tinkler 's buildev had helped to fund the campaign against mckay .

it featured , among other things , unmarked flyers distributed in mckay 's electorate claiming that her preferred project for the mayfield site , a container terminal , would see up to 1,000 trucks rumbling through the local area at all hours of day and night .
tinkler is likely to face questions on all these matters and more throughout his next few hours in the stand .

Tinkler moves to clear his name ahead of half-billion dollar Wall St investment drive

bulletin.text: Disgraced former Labor minister Joe Tripodi answers allegations he did Buildev's bidding inside the former Labor government, and secretly worked to unseat his own colleague, former Newcastle MP Jodi McKay.
